parts.instructions: You are going to read a magazine article about public speaking. For questions 7-14, choose the answer (A, B, C or D) which you think fits best according to the text.

passage.title: Speaking with Confidence
passage.content:
How does the van driver feel after getting help from Nina?

A) Impressed by the way she works
B) embarrassed that he needed it
C) relieved at finding it in time
D) unconvinced by her advice

Why did Nina take over the running of the business?

A) to fulfil a promise to her husband
B) to stop her sons fighting over it
C) to make sure it stayed in the family
D) to prove that she could manage it

'Keep on at' in line 34 describes a way of

A) trying to make someone laugh.
B) trying to accept something.
C) trying to convince someone.
D) trying to make something easier.

The writer finds it strange that

A) Bill allows his mother to work at her age.
B) Nina knows exactly when she will retire.
C) Bill doesn't find a way to help his mother.
D) Nina does a job that is unsuitable for her.

Why, in the writer's opinion, does Nina want to carry on working at the garage?

A) She feels that working keeps her young.
B) She enjoys the working atmosphere.
C) She is genuinely interested in the work.
D) She looks forward to more expensive holidays.

Why do Nina's family sigh when she mentions the problem with the drinks machine?

A) They don't feel responsible for it.
B) They wish they had noticed it first.
C) They realise that she's in control again.
D) They feel that she is being unreasonable.

When Nina hurt her back, she

A) wasn't able to go on with the building work.
B) missed her usual job of repairing the tyres.
C) annoyed her daughter-in-law.
D) blamed her injury on having to fix the tyres.

sections.title: Preparation
sections.content: With a wedding cake or something like that, if it is cut before the director is satisfied, I have to go and make it look untouched. Few of them would have had an oven, so most meat would be cooked over a fire.

sections.title: Delivery Techniques
sections.content: Supermarkets stock most things all year round, but food is not always in the correct form. And, if it is actually going to be eaten, hygiene must be considered.

sections.title: Audience Engagement
sections.content: I never really paid much attention to history lessons at school and now this is one of the aspects of the work that I enjoy the most.

sections.title: Managing Nerves
sections.content: Without the use of chemicals, they probably looked a bit marked and oddly shaped.

sections.title: Voice and Body Language
sections.content: The work is obviously good fun, otherwise I wouldn't do it, but it's perhaps not as glamorous as people imagine.

sections.title: Final Tips
sections.content: The film was set a hundred years ago and my job was to prepare the food for a dinner-party scene.

parts.instructions: You are going to read a magazine article in which four women who turned a hobby into a way of making a living. For questions 22-35, choose from the women (A-D). The women may be chosen more than once. There is an example at the beginning (0).

people.name: Carmen Martinez
people.text: I responded to encouragement from my teacher when I was studying art at college. I had always enjoyed making jewelry, but one line of work was not profitable enough initially. I responded to an advertisement for a course in jewelry design and found a lot of work through personal recommendations. I have plans to set up my own company and enjoy the comments I receive while working. I got ideas by looking in various publications and developed a skill out of financial necessity.

people.name: Sofia Rodriguez
people.text: I regularly take control of large-scale projects and like to produce things for a specific age group. I say I feel it's important to continue learning and have found an export market for my work. I was required to get a qualification and took a relaxed approach to finding out about my subject. I have recently developed a new skill.
